values: Here I am staying up late. I just can't sleep. I hate sleeping. Tonight I just want to rebel and refuse to sleep. Sigh.

Okay, so not every character in the novel is furry, but I have anamorphic foxes and cats, as well as some really cool dragons with great abilities. Check out the first 10% for free or buy the book! It is available through Amazon.com as well as Kindle, Nook, Sony eReader, and every other kind of ebook out there.

http://www.grendelmen.com

Every now and then I get to take a look back at where I have been. I'm not the man I was 5 years ago, just as then I was not the man I was 5 years previous. Life continues to provide an endless array of lessons and somehow I manage to survive them and grow a bit more. To those inadvertently left behind, I miss most of you. It would be so much fun to return to California, but I can see that many of those I wish to go back for have moved on as well. Old friends, new friends, and others, what is the best format for maintaining long distance friendships?

Larikaz

I don't know if anyone still reads this blog, as I have moved on to Facebook and blog.grendelmen.com In case someone DOES read this, I am posting an immediate need for an artist willing to draw a color drawing for the cover of my novel, soon to be released.  This will be a paid commission, terms to be discussed. I need someone who can draw a decent dragon as well as a midevil city with castle. If you have links to some dragons you've done in the past, I would appreciate that.

Larikaz
please email me directly if you can.

I know that many of my friends are disappointed by the results of the recent election.  I find it horrible that a group of people have decided to protest mostly against my religion.  As recent events have shown, this isn't just about the rights of gays to marry.  It's about the rights of the extremists to push their liberal agenda on all children attending public schools.  It's about forcing society to embrace what many still do not accept and what a few still do not tolerate.  I need to know from my gay friends an answer to these questions:

1. Are you aware of what is being taught in Massachusetts schools to children as young as kindergarten?

2. Do you think it is right?

This fight for me, is about freedom of religion.  If gay marriage becomes part of the national law, it's only a small step to take action against religions which won't accept or perform gay marriages.  As you can see by the way the protests have gone, LGBT wants the LDS church to start performing gay marriages.  The line has been drawn in the sand, and I cannot stand by while it is eroded. That is why this election was important to me.  That is why I agree with prop 8.  I am proud to be a Latter-day Saint.  Especially at times like this.

Larikaz

Today I worked up a Calendar of Events for my novel.  It's amazing what I will go through to avoid actually writing.  Oh well.  I realized today that I had forgotten to take leap years into account.  In Puji, the first day of the year is defined as the day of the Vernal Equinox.  This means that every 188 years there is a year with one less day.  Had to calculate which years those were so I could calculate my lunar cycles.  Sounds a bit crazy for a fantasy novel, I know, but that's just part of my personality.  :p

Larikaz

I am at that tipping point in writing my novel.  33,000 words and counting.  I have a lot of action left to write into this thing and most of my critiques tell me to add more.  If you are reading this, and would like to read my novel, too, just let me know.

Larikaz

Larikaz

I have decided to put back up the Grendelmen website.  This site is dedicated to critiquing works of Strange Fiction.  Check out the site if you dare, and let me know what you think.  Do you want your story there?  Do you want to read other peoples stories and give constructive feedback?  Then the Grendelmen is right for you!

The Grendelmen have risen again

In looking back through the postings and responses I've received in the last 4+ years of having an LJ, I just wanted to give a shout out to those of you that know me well.  Cause you really are good people.  I have good people in my life.  That means a lot to me.  I miss my friends from California and it seems like the group has become scattered in the last couple of years.  So, if you're reading this, and you know somewhat about my history, cause you've been there for me, I just wanted to say thanks for being there.


Larikaz the Ai_Dragon

When I stop and consider the sum of knowledge of the human race at this point in history, I have to wonder how much of what is believed is based on incorrect assumptions and misinterpretations of observations.  Certainly there are truths which are hidden from the everyday man, but not because it is supposed to be that way.  Instead, the society we live in encourages us to ignore the supernatural and existential in favor of the concrete and mundane.  Reach out with your mind and feel the world around you.  Can you sense more than you can see?  Is there more happening underneath the superficial layer we all live in?  The answer is yes.  There is more than enough power contained in a single moment to change the course of your life, open your mind to a new truth, and/or remember who you really are.
So I've finally found a new job. I'm moving onward and upwards. Things are going to start improving. Ask if you want more details.

Another week has passed. Things are not improving. How can anyone go this long without some source of income? How am I supposed to have hope? Each day that goes by without an improvement is a day less of hope. I try not to think about the despair. I felt like I needed to reach out to a friend, someone to talk to. I pondered it for awhile and wasn't sure who I could call anymore. Wasn't sure who to reach out to. I'm isolating myself without meaning to. Being cut off from my friends in SoCal doesn't help. Having no professional social circle doesn't help. I have so many needs and feel I have nothing to give right now. The more I think about it, the less I want to try to fix things. There I am, at the bottom of a hole. Does anyone have a ladder?

Larikaz

Wow. Lots happening in 9 weeks, and the next nine weeks will be just as wonderful and crazy. As some of you know, and others may have guessed, I have moved to the Phoenix area and am still looking for that perfect job with the $40-$50/hour wage and working on the next space shuttle or something. Well, actually, that's exactly what I've been submitting my resume for. Anyhow, things are going good, I just miss the furry community. Well, that shouldn't be too hard to phix. 

Larikaz the Ai_Dragon

Hahahahahahah! Look at me!

This morning rain. Is this June gloom in August, or the beginning of a very wet season?
Either way, I'm outta here in 6 weeks or less. Good to know all of you, and hope to keep in touch in some way. Southern California is just killing me. Be in Phoenix soon.

Larikaz the crazy dragon

Lately Marshmallow has been begging to be outside at all hours of the day and night. Last night he didn't come in and I didn't want to go get him. I thought I heard him in the other room and shut the door. I get up this morning and start going about my routine. In the middle of my scripture study I get the feeling that I need to go check on him. He isn't inside. Instead, he is crying outside the door, begging to be let in. He wasn't there earlier. But he was there when I thought that I needed to check on him. So is he sending psychic signals? Hee hee hee.

Larikaz

No, I'm not talking about illegal aliens. I've decided that what is in the past needs to stay there. I'm giving amnesty to all those who have stolen from me or otherwise abused my nievety. I know the amount of money rises into the hundreds, and I could really use that money right now, but I'm ready to let it go. Forgiveness is as forgiveness does.

David

So it's been almost a year since I got married, and things are going really well. It has kept me busy, though, and I know I kind of just disappeared from the community. Zot was kind enough to invite me to a party, which I was ready to attend, but I never got a call back about the specific weekend. Maybe it's already happened, and maybe it hasn't. I'm just letting you guys know that at least for the next 4 to 6 weeks, I'm still in Southern California.
Life throws curve balls sometimes, but lately the ball tossing machine has heat seeking missiles and rapid fire technology. Trails sore and many heaped upon my head. Where do I reach? For a friend.

I have wondered if any of you have noticed my relative absence at any and all events. Getting married has definitely changed me. I think it changes everyone. I am doing my best to keep up with the LJs of those people I wish I had more contact with. In case you are wondering what is happening in my life, I am still loving the marriage scene and still feel like a newlywed. Jenn is working full time and work is hot and cold for me. Sometimes I have plenty of work or a large job, and some days I have nothing to do but play solitaire. I know, it's a rough life. Jenn really likes her new VUE. Sometimes I think her favorite feature is the seat warmers.

Happy Thoughts for the past whenever
1. Back to the Gym. I always feel better when I get in at least three days at the gym.
2. Reduced Anxiety
3. Stargate is back on!
4. That crazy Carlos
5. I can afford a new car? Have you seen my credit report?

Thursday Morning I fly to Charleston, South Carolina. Saturday Night I fly back. In the interim I will be rubbing elbows with the professors and students of a medical school I am hoping to attend. I don't know what is expected of me. I do know they haven't made their final decision and their impression of me will determine if I'm on the top of the list or on the bottom. If all goes well I will leave California in early August, just after my first wedding anniversary. My wife has spent most of her life in California. I've spent most of my life in the Mountain states or the West Coast. Going to the East Coast would be a big change for both of us. If things don't go well, I'll probably look for a job in an area where we can afford to live on one income. 

Intellectually, I'm really looking forward to this trip. Emotionally, I'm totally freaking out. There's so much pressure, and I have difficulty with change. So much has changed recently. I went from no debt to massive debt, I got married, I moved, my parents came for a visit, we got two cats, and I bought a used car for my wife to drive. Now I'm looking at moving 3000 miles away and going back to school. All things considered, it's a wonder I haven't had a melt down. Well, actually, I kind of did before my parents arrived. That was the toughest to handle. Oh well. Ever onward!

Larikaz

2. Lo-Jack
3. Relaxing at home with my wife.

Life is pretty good again. Money is tight, but that's to be expected when I spend more than half a paycheck in one day. Oh well. Payday is Thursday and everything should be fine then. I leave for South Carolina on Thursday. I am a bit nervous, but I have a feeling everything will work out.

1. Less Down Time at Work
2. Steak! Yum!
3. Dresden Files: Great Show
4. Found Marshmallow. He was hiding.
5. Time with Jenn

If you haven't had the pleasure of watching The Dresden Files on Sci-Fi, it's a show about a Wizard that solves crimes. It's kind of like Medium, but with a Wizard. As for Marshmallow, we let him out to play outside and he didn't come in when it was bed time. So we went looking for him and he had found a path behind some of the apartments in our complex. Neither of us knew it was there, and Marshmallow knew he wasn't supposed to be there. It took us about 15 minutes to catch him once we found him. He is a real trouble maker.

In order to divine one's future, one first must understand the present and determine some possible consequences of one's current situation. It helps when you can hear God's whisperings meant specifically for you. What one must avoid is telling their therapist that God speaks to them directly. Why do we have glimpses of our future? To show us which path to take at key moments. Ever had deja vu? That is remembering that you saw that moment in a flash of the future. Many people do not see these flashes in their conscious mind, but instead they dwell in the unconscious where they direct our actions in an indirect way. It is only when the end is achieved that the conscious mind is made aware that a specific goal has been reached. A specific moment marking your steps on a path has occurred. There are events in life that we cannot easily avoid. There are trials we are meant to have because we agreed before this life they would be best for us. Others come from our own stupidity. I don't know anyone that can easily tell the difference.

Larikaz

Well, after 5 months of trying to rid myself of the depression which has haunted me my whole life, I'm finally back at work. It hasn't been easy getting everything going again. All the work that I had before I left is either done, or being worked on by others. it can take awhile to build up enough work to take up a full week or time. I've only been able to do that once or twice in the six years that I've been working here. I know most people wouldn't complain about having free time at work, but I feel like I'm cheating the company. It just feeds into my anxiety and I worry that they are going to let me go because I don't put enough time into the few tasks they give me. I long to be somewhere that judges people on their throughput instead of on how much time they put into something. One place this is true is college. That's one of the reasons I'm going back. I'm getting my doctorate in Statistics and moving to a company where my talents pay enough to raise a family without worrying about having enough to pay the mortgage. 
I copied 4.5 GB of music onto my computer today. I had about 3 GB when I left, but they lost all my data when they upgraded my computer to XP. It seems they didn't really think through what happens if someone is on a long vacation or extended leave of absence. They are checking the tape backups, but I'm not going to hold my breath. The other thing missing when I got back was my monitor. Someone swapped it for a 19" CRT. Well, they forgot to leave the cables, so I couldn't hook it up. I've informed security and I wonder what they will do if they find it on someone's desk. Oh well. Not my concern anymore. Onward and upward.

Larikaz

Somehow I think I forgot to mention the acquisition of the latest member of our family. Her name is Sno-Ball and is just over 8 weeks old. Now Marshmallow has a sister to play with. They are getting along for the most part. Is it normal for cats to wrestle?

Other than that, my pdoc says it'll probably be the first of the year before I get back to work. That's a bummer, but I got to do what I got to do to get better, you know? My wife's job is going well, and helps with the reduced pay. Going up to Idaho for Thanksgiving. When I get back, if you want to hang out with me, just let me know. I have lots of free time on my hands right now.

Larikaz

I know the atonement is one of the holy mysteries in the Catholic church, but in the LDS church, it is well spelled out. God decreed a law in heaven before the world was that all actions have consequences. One of those consequences is pain. When you sin, the consequence is feeling the horrible feeling of being drawn away from God. It was also decreed that no one person could permanantely take the suffering of another unless that person had done nothing to deserve suffering. Jesus led a perfect life in which he committed no sin and took no actions that would require suffering on His part, except in seeing the choices of others. When Christ went to the Garden of Gethsemane, He was tormented with infinite suffering. He suffered body, mind, and soul. He felt every pain that anyone in the universe could ever feel and He felt it to the most extreme example there was.

This act of God allows us to end our suffering from sin or other actions. All we have to do is call upon God, in the name of Christ to end the suffering, and, God willing, Christ takes that suffering from us because He has already felt it for us. For sins, this is acheived through prayer and sometimes through confession to the proper authorities and true repentance. For temporal pains, this can be achieved through prayer and sometimes through the power of the priesthood, requiring faith on the part of the injured or sick.

The other half of the atonement began when Christ died on the cross. He was literally the Son of God. He had the power to come down off the cross and live. Nothing in this world could kill Him. But He allowed the Romans and the Jews to cause His body enough suffering that His soul would be able to leave His body. Christ sacrificed immortality among us for a greater goal that He achieved through faith. He and He alone had the power to take His body back after it had been dead. No one in the universe had been able to do that before Him. He could do it because He was the first born of the Father, the Anointed One. For some reason which I do not understand, when Christ's spirit reentered His body, it made it possible for others to be resurrected. And many were that day. Because of Christ's resurrection, it is guaranteed that all men (and women) who receive a body will be resurrected, whether they want to be or not.

There is one more aspect of the atonement that is often overlooked, but which is just as vital to God's plan of Salvation. When Christ's body lay in the tomb, His spirit was in the spirit world creating a bridge of sorts between Spirit Prison and Spirit Paradise. Only then, after Christ's visit to the spirit world could the missionary work to the dead begin. Only then could the empowered and baptized go and visit those who died without baptism and begin to teach them. Then, if they accept what they are taught, and someone acts as their proxy on this earth to do the necessary ordinances, they could progress to Spirit Paradise or even Resurrection.

If I have left anything out of the wonders of the atonement, please feel free to comment.

Larikaz

There are times when things look bleak and you struggle to get by. And there are times when things go by smoothly. I've been having a rough time for the past couple of months, but things are starting to improve. My wife got a job, which will help out a lot. A one income family just can't survive in Southern California. Also, my medications seem to have started working. I'm not as depressed. I've skipped a couple of parties due to the depression. Hopefully I can get out to more of them now. I have also noticed that I don't progress much spiritually when I'm depressed. With that gone, maybe I can connect with God more and find the next few steps on my path.

In case you couldn't tell, I have a pretty good life. I am a newlywed with a wife that loves me deeply. I have a decent place to live and money coming in. I have lots of electronic toys that I use quite often. Life is good. In fact, life is great. There is just one little thing that gets in my way. Depression. I'm fighting it, and right now it is winning. Well, that's a summation of my life right now.

The cat is fun. He's a bit crazy sometimes and he likes to bite. But he's still cute.

Larikaz

My cat Marshmallow is such a spaz. He runs all over the place, loves playing in boxes, and attacks any little thing that gets left on the floor. He chases his tail while we are trying to sleep. Oh well. Fun with a cat.

Larikaz
We just added to our little family. Here is a pic of our beautiful baby girl.

So I have gone and gotten married. For those of you that haven't heard, I'm letting you know right now. I found the perfect person for me and she is just wonderful. I hope you all get a chance to meet her and get to know her. As I move into married life I am noticing that my free time has dwindled. If you want a meet with me, let me know and I'll see what I can do. Let me just tell you that I had a fabulous honeymoon and everything is still going great! We went to a small island called Nassau. Right next store is Paradise. We spent some of our time in Paradise, and now I have returned to the real world, but nothing will ever be the same again. I am more of the person I have always been. But now I finally feel complete. I have accomplished everything I needed to do in this life. I could die a happy man right now. That being said, I am looking forward to what is to come. Big plans in the works. Trying to change my economic status and all that. Anyway, just wanted to update you on where I've been!

Larikaz

Sometimes life goes backwards and puts you where you've already been. I had somehow hoped I was past this, that it was all in the past. I knew that wasn't completely possible, but I had hope nonetheless. But today, looking at what is going on, I have to admit to myself that the medications just aren't sufficient anymore. I'm better off than I was 2 years ago, but I'm still not comfortable with where I am. Sigh. Chemical depression really bites. 

Larikaz

So I guess I've disproved the theory that all you have to do to start a successful LJ group is to set it up and wait for the people to just pour in. I guess my group of interest was simply too narrow an interest group. Oh well. Seems I'll have to seek out a group that is similar, but not quite right. So much for getting everything I wanted.

Larikaz

I want to dedicate this song to Voy and Rex.

But most of all, I hear the calling
Of the watchman after hours

I want to be the night security
I want to own a tiny TV
With the sound turned down, and no one around
I'll sing so very loud

I want to be the night security
I want to sleep right in my clothes
I want to open my eyes, as people walk by
And whisper "who's that guy?"

Its massive size implies
The scope of what I'm able
To unlock any time

I want to be the night security

What type of Fae are you? Wheeee! I'm a Nymph! What are you?!

Here I am, sitting at work on a Friday afternoon, right after a nice lunch, and I'm feeling the blahs. I don't see why I should feel the blahs, but there they are. Admittedly it's not as bad as the 'I wanna kill myself' blues that I used to have to deal with, but the blahs are getting very annoying lately. I can't seem to get less than ten hours of sleep and feel groggy when I do get up. What is up with that!?

My life really is going quite well. Things are moving along in a positive direction, but I seem unable to enjoy that right now at this moment. So here I am, feeling the blahs, wondering when I am going to get to this great future I have planned for myself. I want something better, and I want it NOW!

Larikaz

So, as some of you know, I'm engaged to be married. Lots of things are going through my head right now. Mostly that my life is changing forever, no matter what happens. If you want to meet her, you'll have to come to the birthday party for Voy this weekend. It's really frustrating not having the ring yet. When I do, I'll post a pic of it, so you can all get a good look.
